column4: Tesla hit by class-action lawsuit claiming racial discrimination
column5: U.S. automaker Tesla Inc on Monday was hit with a class-action lawsuit claiming its California production plant is a "hotbed for racist behavior."

column4: VC firm DFJ's founding partner takes leave amid sexual harassment probe
column5: Nov 13 Steve Jurvetson  founder partner of venture capital firm Draper Fisher Jurvetson (DFJ)  said on Monday he would take a leave of absence while an internal probe into sexual harassment allegations against him continues.

column4: Qualcomm rejects Broadcom's $103 billion takeover proposal
column5: Nov 13 Mobile chipmaker Qualcomm Inc on Monday rejected rival Broadcom Ltd's $103 billion takeover bid  saying the offer "dramatically" undervalued the U.S. company.

column4: Qualcomm draws up plans to rebuff Broadcom's $103 billion offer: sources
column5: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  is making preparations to reject rival Broadcom Ltd's  $103 billion bid as early as this week  four people familiar with the matter said on Sunday  setting the stage for one of the biggest-ever takeover battles.
